contextId.information: This word is used here to mark a break in the main storyline. Here the author tells background information about the disciples forgetting to bring bread. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This parenthetical sentence tells background information about Peter, James, and John. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: For he did not know what to say, for they were terrified

contextId.information: This word is used here to mark a break in the main storyline as the author shifts to telling background information about Pilate's tradition of releasing a prisoner at feasts and about Barabbas. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This is background information about why Jesus was handed over to Pilate. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: For he knew that it was because of envy ... Jesus over to him

contextId.information: This is background information about who the passerby is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: a man named Simon of Cyrene the father of Alexander and Rufus

contextId.information: "When Jesus was in Galilee these women followed him ... with him to Jerusalem." This is background information about the women who watched the crucifixion from a distance. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: When he was in Galilee they followed him ... with him to Jerusalem

contextId.information: This is background information about Joseph. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: He was a respected member of the council ... for the kingdom of God
